body.bodyHtml:
Valencia walked of the pitch in protest at alleged racist abuse directed at defender Mouctar Diakhaby by CÃ¡dizâ€™s Juan Cala on Sunday afternoon, only to come back on again and complete the game without him.

The La Liga match was stopped after 29 minutes following conversations with the referee, Valencia captain JosÃ© Luis GayÃ  leading the team off, but it restarted again around 20 minutes later with Diakhaby watching from the stands as his team mates played without him. Cala was not replaced at first, although he was then substituted at half time.

Diakhaby and Cala went in for a challenge together, clashed, and as the Valencia defender was heading back to his position, he suddenly turned and angrily went back towards Cala. As Gabriel Paulista and Kevin Gameiro tried to calm him down and pull him away, cameras caught Paulista saying: â€œNegro de mierda - noâ€ [â€œshitty black â€“ noâ€]

Diakhaby explained to the referee what had been said and Paulista and GayÃ  led the team off, the players gathering in the lower tier of the stand. The referee, David MediÃ© JimÃ©nez, spoke toCala who could be seen saying that he had â€œnot done anything.â€ Some conversations continued between footballers and staff, but CÃ¡dizâ€™s players too headed off - in their case down the tunnel.

A few minutes later, Valenciaâ€™s playerscame out to warm up without Dikhaby. After a five minute re-warm-up, the game started again. Spanish referees do have the authority to stop games in the event of hearing racist abuse. The league has delegates at every game.

Valenciaâ€™s later released a statement saying: â€œThe team has met up and decided to return to the pitch to fight for the badge, but firm in their condemnation of all forms of racism.â€

Another tweet soon after said that it had been Diakhaby himself who had wanted the team to continue, although he did feel in condition to play himself.

â€œWe offer our complete backing to Dikhaby,â€ the tweet said. â€œThe player, who had received a racial insult, requested that his team-mates return to the pitch. We SUPPORT YOU MOUCTAR.â€

The remaining 15 minutes were played until half time, watched from the stands by Diakhaby. Cala continued to play until the break but did not return for the second half as his side ended up winning 2-1.

Valencia are expected to make a formal complaint after the game, either with the league or the Spanish football federation, with sanctions likely to follow from there.

content.webTitle: Valencia walk off against CÃ¡diz after Diakhaby accuses opponent of racist abuse
